summary: This is a travel authorization email from the DOJ's E2 travel system approving a trip for a witness interview in the U.S. v. Epstein case. The traveler was scheduled to go to Santa Monica, CA from November 13-15, 2019, for the purpose of interviewing a witness.

events.title: Witness Interview Travel Authorization
events.description: Travel authorization was approved for a DOJ employee or agent to travel to Santa Monica, CA to conduct a witness interview for the U.S. v. Epstein case.

keyFacts: A travel authorization was approved on December 5, 2019, for a trip related to the U.S. v. Epstein case.
The trip's purpose was a witness interview, coded as R20NYS13179, indicating it was part of the New York Southern District case against Epstein.
The travel was scheduled for November 13-15, 2019, to Santa Monica, California.
The document shows the DOJ was actively conducting witness interviews in the Epstein case in late 2019, after Epstein's death in August 2019.
The authorization process used the DOJ's internal E2 travel system, indicating official government business.
